text: Americans have responded to the
earthquake in Haiti with unbelievable
generosity but this isn't Haiti
this is eastern Congo the side of the
most lethal conflict since World War Two
and these people as well
desperately need the world's help the
hills west of Lake Piru are beautiful
but that beauty belies the horrific
atrocities that occur here daily they
have continued for 12 years largely
because the international community
hasn't been particularly interested in
this war we're trying hard to stop it
those who pay the price are civilians
like this new nine-year-old orphan
chance to bhalo one evening last May a
Hutu militia attacked her home
the militia consists of remnants of
those who committed the Rwandan genocide
and later escaped to Congo about six
o'clock I saw a group of soldiers they
were a big group the soldiers killed my
parents and kidnapped my sisters I was
lucky to flee I fled until I reached my
aunt at last count in 2007 5.4 million
people had died in the war some of them
were killed with bullets or machetes but
more often they died from starvation and
disease 1 million people were uprooted
from their homes last year alone
including these people receiving rural
food program Aid and calejo it's a war
that has also become synonymous with
brutal rape I took on a dog show I was
13 I went to the fields and ran into the
Hutu militia they raped me there were
five of them two months after a chance
moved in with her aunt
jaian dear agony the same militia
attacked again they burst into the house
and held everyone at gunpoint this time
there was no escape the soldiers first
shot her uncle and then pulled out a
knife they sliced his belly so the
intestines fell out then they cut his
heart out and showed it to me National
another fool upon the soldiers continue
to mutilate the body while others began
to rape jaian
one takes a leg one takes the other leg
others grab the arms while one just
starts reaping they don't care if
children are watching me I'm according
to my fakty there were six who raped her
one raped me too the soldiers kidnapped
drains two daughters and left her and
chance tied up three days passed before
they were discovered they kidnapped my
other children I don't know if they're
alive or dead that was a year ago so I
imagine that they're dead jaian and
chance like so many other rape survivors
are getting help from the International
Rescue Committee both contracted
sexually transmitted diseases from the
assault chance still suffers pain when
she urinates as well as the fear of yet
another attack while jaian and chance
survived rape has marked them most raped
women are rejected by their husbands and
rape girls will have difficulty marrying
in an encampment where attacks are
continuing and that's a label on those
and I asked him when he married his
girlfriend if she were raped never I
would abandon her at once
normally you're a girl gets a bright
price when she marries that's a reverse
dowry paid by the husband's family
a village he told me that a typical
bride price there would be equivalent to
20 under she ever commander rush a raped
woman is only worth two goats if that in
such an environment it takes tremendous
courage for jaian and chance to tell
their stories they kill they rape they
burn houses and take people's belongings
when they come with their guns is this
if they have a project to eliminate the
local population so that they can claim
the place under image about heyoka and
wounded I joke I'll be reporting more
from Congo in the coming days I hope
that the fortitude of these people can
inspire the global community to step
forward and stop this slaughter I've
been moved by the outpouring of support
for Haiti I'd love to see the same
interest and support for Congolese like
Joanne and chance in Calleja Congo for
the New York Times I'm Nicholas Kristof
